pr_title: Suppress error-prone java.lang clash warning for XML types

timeline.message:
Suppress error-prone java.lang clash warning for XML types

Regrettably we have XML tags named "String" and "Number", we cannot
change the tag name. This update suppresses the error prone warning
to avoid compilation warning messages that we cannot readily fixed.

timeline.bodyText: Thoughts on introducing a tag to override the class name?
timeline.author: RoiEXLab

replies.bodyText: AFAIK tags cannot inherit tags. Is there actually a way to do that? If so, having the XML annotation to go ahead and add suppress warnings for 'unused' would be good. The lang clash is very limited, I would not expect for us to see more of it and if we introduce more lang clashes it's something that IMO we should very well fix. These tags being named after lang classes is really not ideal.
replies.author: DanVanAtta

replies.bodyText: I was more thinking of a @CustomName("String") tag, so the class can be called whatever it wants to but if this annotation is present it will "override" the class name to use the custom string instead
replies.author: RoiEXLab
